Na aktiváciu viacfaktorovej autentifikácie pre svoj účet potrebujete:

LocaleResource.Name: eucookielaw.description
LocaleResource.Value: 26. mája 2011 sa zmenili pravidlá pre súbory cookie na webových stránkach. Táto stránka používa cookies. Jeden alebo viac súborov cookie, ktoré používame, sú nevyhnutné na to, aby fungovali časti týchto webových stránok, a už boli nastavené. Môžete odstrániť a zablokovať všetky súbory cookie z tohto webu, ale časti stránok nebudú fungovať. Ak sa chcete dozvedieť viac o súboroch cookie používaných na tomto webe a o tom, ako súbory cookie odstrániť, prečítajte si naše zásady ochrany osobných údajov

LocaleResource.Name: eucookielaw.description2
LocaleResource.Value: Súbory cookie nám pomáhajú poskytovať služby. Používaním našich služieb súhlasíte s používaním súborov cookie.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.externalauth.facebook.instructions
LocaleResource.Value:
To configure authentication with Facebook, please follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Facebook for Developers page and sign in. If you don't already have a Facebook account, use the Sign up for Facebook link on the login page to create one.
  2. Tap the + Add a New App button in the upper right corner to create a new App ID. (If this is your first app with Facebook, the text of the button will be Create a New App.)
  3. Fill out the form and tap the Create App ID button.
  4. The Product Setup page is displayed, letting you select the features for your new app. Click Get Started on Facebook Login.
  5. Click the Settings link in the menu at the left, you are presented with the Client OAuth Settings page with some defaults already set.
  6. Enter "{0:s}signin-facebook" into the Valid OAuth Redirect URIs field.
  7. Click Save Changes.
  8. Click the Dashboard link in the left navigation.
  9. Copy your App ID and App secret below.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.manual.instructions
LocaleResource.Value: This payment method stores credit card information in database (it's not sent to any third-party processor). In order to store credit card information, you must be PCI compliant.

LocaleResource.Value: Enter additional fee to charge your customers.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypaldirect.fields.passpurchaseditems.hint

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypaldirect.instructions
LocaleResource.Value:
If you're using this gateway ensure that your primary store currency is supported by PayPal.

To configure plugin follow these steps:
1. Log into your Developer PayPal account (click here to create your account).
2. Click on My Apps & Credentials from the Dashboard.
3. Create new REST API app.
4. Copy your Client ID and Secret key below.
5. To be able to use recurring payments you need to set the webhook ID. You can get it manually in your PayPal account (enter the URL {0} below REST API application credentials), or automatically by pressing "{1}" button (not visible when running the site locally).

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypaldirect.webhookerror
LocaleResource.Value: Webhook was not created (see details in the log)

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypalstandard.fields.additionalfee.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Enter additional fee to charge your customers.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypalstandard.fields.additionalfeepercentage.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Determines whether to apply a percentage additional fee to the order total. If not enabled, a fixed value is used.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypalstandard.fields.passproductnamesandtotals
LocaleResource.Value: Pass product names and order totals to PayPal

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypalstandard.fields.passproductnamesandtotals.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Check if product names and order totals should be passed to PayPal.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypalstandard.fields.redirectiontip
LocaleResource.Value: You will be redirected to PayPal site to complete the order.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypalstandard.instructions
LocaleResource.Value:
If you're using this gateway ensure that your primary store currency is supported by PayPal.

To use PDT, you must activate PDT and Auto Return in your PayPal account profile. You must also acquire a PDT identity token, which is used in all PDT communication you send to PayPal. Follow these steps to configure your account for PDT:

1. Log in to your PayPal account (click here to create your account).
2. Click on the Profile button.
3. Click on the Account Settings link.
4. Select the Website payments item on left panel.
5. Find Website Preferences and click on the Update link.
6. Under Auto Return for Website payments preferences, select the On radio button.
7. For the Return URL, enter and save the URL on your site that will receive the transaction ID posted by PayPal after a customer payment ({0}).
8. Under Payment Data Transfer, select the On radio button and get your Identity token.
9. Enter Identity token in the field below on the plugin configuration page.
10. Click Save button on this page.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypalstandard.paymentmethoddescription
LocaleResource.Value: You will be redirected to PayPal site to complete the payment

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.paypalstandard.roundingwarning
LocaleResource.Value: It looks like you have "ShoppingCartSettings.RoundPricesDuringCalculation" setting disabled. Keep in mind that this can lead to a discrepancy of the order total amount, as PayPal only rounds to two decimals.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.square.fields.use3ds.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Determine whether to use 3D-Secure feature. Used for Strong customer authentication (SCA). SCA is generally friction-free for the buyer, but a card-issuing bank may require additional authentication for some payments. In those cases, the buyer must verify their identiy with the bank using an additional secure dialog.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.square.instructions
LocaleResource.Value:
Warning: Square sandbox data has been changed. For more information visit our documentation.

For plugin configuration, follow these steps:

1. You will need a Square Merchant account. If you don't already have one, you can sign up here: https://squareup.com/signup/
2. Sign in to 'Square Merchant Dashboard'. Go to 'Account & Settings' → 'Locations' tab and create new location.
Important: Your merchant account must have at least one location with enabled credit card processing. Please refer to the Square customer support if you have any questions about how to set this up.
3. Sign in to your 'Square Developer Dashboard' at https://connect.squareup.com/apps; use the same login credentials as your merchant account.
4. Click on 'Create Your First Application' and fill in the 'Application Name'. This name is for you to recognize the application in the developer portal and is not used by the plugin. Click 'Create Application' at the bottom of the page.
5. Now you are on the details page of the previously created application. On the 'Credentials' tab click on the 'Change Version' button and choose '2019-09-25'.
6. Make sure you uncheck 'Use sandbox' below.
7. In the 'Square Developer Dashboard' go to the details page of the your previously created application:
  • On the 'Credentials' tab make sure the 'Application mode' setting value is 'Production'
  • On the 'Credentials' tab copy the 'Application ID' and paste it into 'Application ID' below
  • Go to 'OAuth' tab. Click 'Show' on the 'Application Secret' field. Copy the 'Application Secret' and paste it into 'Application Secret' below
  • Copy this URL: {0}. On the 'OAuth' tab paste this URL into 'Redirect URL'. Click 'Save'
8. Click 'Save' below to save the plugin configuration.
9. Click 'Obtain access token' below; the Access token field should populate.
Note: If for whatever reason you would like to disable an access to your accounts, simply 'Revoke access tokens' below.
10. Choose the previously created location. 'Location' is a required parameter for payment requests.
11. Fill in the remaining fields and click 'Save' to complete the configuration.

Note: The payment form must be generated only on a webpage that uses HTTPS.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.worldpay.fields.additionalfee.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Enter additional fee to charge your customers.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.worldpay.fields.additionalfeepercentage.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Determines whether to apply a percentage additional fee to the order total. If not enabled, a fixed value is used.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.worldpay.fields.publickey.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Specify the Public key. It will be sent to the email address that you signed up with during the sandbox sign-up process.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.worldpay.fields.savecard
LocaleResource.Value: Save the card data for future purchasing

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.worldpay.fields.securekey.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Specify the Secure key. You can obtain the Secure Key by signing into the Virtual Terminal with the login credentials that you were emailed to you during the sign-up process. You will then need to navigate to Settings and click on the Key Management link.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.worldpay.fields.securenetid.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Specify the SecureNet ID. You will get this in an email shortly after signing up for your account.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.worldpay.fields.usesandbox.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Determine whether to enable sandbox (testing environment).

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.worldpay.fields.validateaddress.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Determine whether to validate customers' billing addresses on processing payments.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.worldpay.fields.worldpaycustomerid.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Displays Worldpay Vault customer ID. If the customer is not yet stored in the Worldpay Vault, specify the customer ID and click the button 'Store customer to the Worldpay Vault'

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.payments.worldpay.instructions
LocaleResource.Value:
For plugin configuration follow these steps:

  • 1. Sign up for a Merchant Account
  • 2. Upon merchant account approval an email will be sent to you with your Virtual Terminal credentials where you can obtain your SecureNet ID, Secure Key and Public Key
  • 3. Steps to obtain each:
    • a. Sign into the Virtual Terminal with the login credentials that you received
    • b. The SecureNet ID will be found on the upper right hand side of your Virtual Terminal page
    • c. To obtain your Keys, navigate to the Settings tab and select the Key Management link
    • d. Select appropriate tab – SecureKey or Public Key
  • 4. Fill in the remaining fields and save to complete the configuration

Note: This plugin supports merchants domiciled in the United States only.
Note: The Worldpay US platform supports only USD currency; ensure that you have correctly configured the exchange rate from your primary store currency to the USD currency.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.shipping.fixedbyweightbytotal.fields.limitmethodstocreated.hint

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.shipping.fixedbyweightbytotal.fields.warehouse.hint

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.shipping.fixedbyweightbytotal.fields.zip.hint

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.shipping.fixedbyweightbytotal.formula.value

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.tax.avalara.fields.enablelogging.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Determine whether to enable logging of all requests to Avalara services.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.tax.avalara.fields.gettaxratebyaddressonly.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Determine whether to get tax rates by the address only. This may lead to not entirely accurate results (for example, when a customer is exempt to tax, or the product belongs to a tax category that has a specific rate), but it will significantly reduce the number of GetTax API calls. This applies only to tax rates in the catalog, on the checkout full information is always used in requests.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.widgets.googleanalytics.instructions
LocaleResource.Value:
Google Analytics is a free website stats tool from Google. It keeps track of statistics about the visitors and eCommerce conversion on your website.

Follow the next steps to enable Google Analytics integration:

  • Create a Google Analytics account and follow the wizard to add your website
  • Copy the Tracking ID into the 'ID' box below
  • Click the 'Save' button below and Google Analytics will be integrated into your store

If you would like to switch between Google Analytics (used by default) and Universal Analytics, then please use the buttons below:

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.widgets.googleanalytics.trackingscript.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Paste the tracking code generated by Google Analytics here. {GOOGLEID} and {CUSTOMER_TRACKING} will be dynamically replaced.

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.widgets.googleanalytics.usejstosendecommerceinfo
LocaleResource.Value: Use JS to send eCommerce info

LocaleResource.Name: plugins.widgets.googleanalytics.usejstosendecommerceinfo.hint
LocaleResource.Value: Check to use JS code to send eCommerce info from the order completed page. But in case of redirection payment methods some customers may skip it. Otherwise, eCommerce information will be sent using HTTP request. Information is sent each time an order is paid but UTM is not supported in this mode.
